Bray.grammar: Bré is a direct transliteration. No article is used.

Dublin.grammar: Baile (town) + Átha Cliath (of the hurdle ford). Genitive case used in 'Átha'.

Kinsale.grammar: Headland of the Sea; 'Cionn' (head, prepositional variant of Ceann) causes urú in 'Sáile' (
), hence 'tSáile'. This is a noun + genitive noun construction.
